leukapp.apps.individuals.models module¶

Models and database schemas for the individuals application.

See Django’s Model Documentation for more information.

class Individual(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: leukapp.apps.core.models.LeukappModel

Top class in the Leukgen’s samples ecosystem, it usually refers to patients, mice and other kind of organisms.

APP_NAME = 'individuals'¶

Name of the application where Individual is contained.

institution = None¶

Indicates whether the Indiviual comes from MSK or not. See the available choices: INSTITUTION.

species = None¶

Indicates the Indiviual species. See the available choices: SPECIES.

ext_id = None¶

Id used by the scientist to track the Indiviual.

This field is validated using the ext_id_validator.

Warning

MRNs are not allowed for HUMANS from MSK. Please use a pseudo MRN or other type of identifier.

tumors_count = None¶
normals_count = None¶
int_id = None¶

Internal ID used to describe the Individual instance.

This value is generated by _get_int_id() and it includes crucial information separated by a “-” character (e.g. E-100000-H).

  • E indicates that the current Individual comes from an external institution different than MSK.
  • 100000 indicates the Indiviual primary key in the leukapp system.
  • H indicates the species of the Indiviual following the character assignment described in INT_ID_SPECIES
slug = None¶

Individual's unique identifier (leukid).

Individual.objects = <django.db.models.manager.Manager object>¶
Individual.specimen_set¶

Accessor to the related objects manager on the reverse side of a many-to-one relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

parent.children is a ReverseManyToOneDescriptor instance.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.

Individual.check_institution()[source]¶

Determines whether or not the Individual comes from MSK.
